entries.zone:
/zone: You zone out.
/zone self: You zone out and ignore your surroundings.
/zone target: You zone out and ignore (target name).
entries.zip:
/zip: You zip your lips.
/zip self: You check your zipper to make sure it's closed.
/zip target: You instruct (target name) to zip (his, her, or its) lips.
entries.yes:
/yes: You nod affirmatively. Yes.
/yes self: You nod at yourself agreeingly.
/yes target: You nod affirmatively to (target name).
entries.yawn:
/yawn: YAAAWWWNN!
/yawn self: You tries to hide a yawn.
/yawn target: You yawn at (him, her, or it).
entries.wtg:
/wtg: Way to go!
/wtg self: You think you did a great job.
/wtg target: You tell (target name) way to go!
entries.wrinkle:
/wrinkle: You wrinkle your nose and make a sour face.
/wrinkle self: You wrinkle your nose at yourself.
/wrinkle target: You wrinkle your nose at (target name).
entries.worship:
/worship: You are not worthy!
/worship self: You are not worthy.
/worship target: You worship (target name).
entries.wookieeroar: /wookieeRoar <target>: This can Intimidate a cone (frontal area ) of multiple enemies at once, alias for
entries.wink:
/wink: Wink.
/wink self: You wink suggestively.
/wink target: You wink suggestively at (target name).
entries.wince:
/wince: You wince.
/wince self: You wince in pain.
/wince target: You wince at (him, her, or it).
entries.wildshot2: /wildshot2 <target>: This ranged attack can stun multiple targets at once.
entries.wildshot1: /wildshot1 <target>: This ranged attack can stun a single target.
entries.wildpanic:
/wildpanic: AAAAAAYYYYYYEEEEEEEE!!!
/wildpanic self: You panic about, waving your hands in the air.
/wildpanic target: You panic about (target name), waving your hands in the air.
entries.whistle:
/whistle: You whistle innocently.
/whistle self: You whistle a chipper tune.
/whistle target: You whistle appreciatively at (him, her, or it).
entries.whimper:
/whimper: You whimper.
/whimper self: You whimper softly to yourself.
/whimper target: You whimper softly at (target name).
entries.whatthe:
/whatthe: What the?
/whatthe self: What were you thinking?
/whatthe target: You wonder what (target name) was thinking?
entries.whap:
/whap: You whap everyone.
/whap self: You whap yourself repeatedly.
/whap target: You whap (him, her, or it) upside the head.
entries.welcome:
/welcome: WELCOME ALL!
/welcome self: You welcome yourself.
/welcome target: Welcome, (target name).
entries.wave:
/wave: You wave.
/wave self: You wave to yourself.
/wave target: You wave to (him, her, or it).
entries.warningshot: /warningshot <target>: This ranged attack can terrify your target, making them unwilling to run towards you to attack.
entries.ward:
/ward: STAY AWAY!
/ward self: Superstitious? You rub a charm to ward off misfortune.
/ward target: You make warding signs at (him, her, or it).
entries.warcry2: /warcry2 <target>: This area combat attack can increase the round times of a cone (frontal area) of multiple enemies simultaneously.
entries.warcry1: /warcry1 <target>: This combat move can increase the round-time of your opponent's attack, in effect slowing them down.
entries.wait:
/wait: You wait.
/wait self: WAIT UP!
/wait target: You wait on (him, her, or it).
entries.waft:
/waft: You try to waft the stench away.
/waft self: Taking a bath might help!
/waft target: You try to keep (his, her, or its) stench away.
entries.vrepairother: /vrepairother: Other Ship's Systems Emergency Repair - This command performs a 'vampiric' repair to currently targeted friendly vessels that are in close proximity.
entries.vrepair: /vrepair: Ship's Systems Emergency Repair - This command performs a 'vampiric' repair by routing most of the load of your most heavily damaged component through other lesser damaged components, at the cost of fusing connections, melting wires, etc. This has the game effect of increasing the health of your most heavily damaged ship component, but damaging the others, moving toward evening out the condition of all your components.
entries.volleyfireattack: This command utilizes the volley fire attack.
entries.volleyfire: /volleyfire <target>: This Squad Leader command directs the fire of the entire group at the target the Squad Leader has chosen.  This enables a Squad Leader's group to cut through a group of difficult creatures/NPCs far more efficiently than a group without a Squad Leader would perform.
entries.vitalize: /vitalize: short-term pool attribute buff; alias for
entries.veto:
/veto: VETO!
/veto self: You veto your own idea.
/veto target: You veto (him, her, or it).
entries.ventriloquism: /ventriloquism <target>: Performs a visual effect around your target
entries.vendor_fees_1: The merchant gains a reduction in the cost of maintaining vendors.
entries.up:
/up: You point up.
/up self: You point up.
/up target: You turn to (target name) and point up.
entries.unregistered: Your city has been unregistered from the planetary map.
entries.uninstallshipcomponent: Uninstall a ship component from a ship.
entries.underhandshot: /underhandshot <target>: This sneaky ranged attack is designed to catch a target unaware, and causes high damage and can also knock them down.
entries.unconsent: /unconsent: This command brings up a window with all of the players who you have consented to move your corpse.  To remove them from this list, click on their name and then click OK.
entries.uncle:
/uncle: UNCLE!! UNCLE!!
/uncle self: Say Uncle! Say Uncle!
/uncle target: You beg (him, her, or it) to stop. UNCLE!
entries.unarmedstun1: /unarmedstun1 <target>: This unarmed attack can stun a single target.
entries.unarmedspinattack2: /unarmedspinattack2 <target>: This unarmed area attack can damage multiple targets at once.  This is more powerful than Unarmed Spin Attack 1.
entries.unarmedspinattack1: /unarmedspinattack1 <target>: This unarmed area attack can damage multiple targets at once.
entries.unarmedlunge2: /unarmedlunge2 <target>: This unarmed attack can slightly extend your range, and has a chance to knock down your target.
entries.unarmedlunge1: /unarmedlunge1 <target>: This unarmed attack can slightly extend your range, and has a chance to lower the posture of your target.
entries.unarmedleghit1: /unarmedleghit1 <target>: This unarmed attack targets the legs in order to damage a target's Action pool.
entries.unarmedknockdown2: /unarmedknockdown2 <target>:This unarmed attack can knock down and dizzy a single target.
entries.unarmedknockdown1: /unarmedknockdown1 <target>: This unarmed attack can knock down a single target.
entries.unarmedhit3: /unarmedhit3 <target>: This powerful unarmed attack inflicts more damage to a single target than Unarmed Hit 2.
entries.unarmedhit2: /unarmedhit2 <target>: This strong unarmed attack inflicts more damage to a single target than Unarmed Hit 1.
entries.unarmedhit1: /unarmedhit1 <target>: This unarmed attack inflicts more damage than the basic unarmed attack.
entries.unarmedheadhit1: /unarmedheadhit1 <target>: This unarmed attack targets the head in order to damage the target's Mind pool.
entries.unarmeddizzy1: /unarmeddizzy1 <target>: This unarmed attack can dizzy a single target.
entries.unarmedcombo2: /unarmedcombo2 <target>: This unarmed attack can hit the head, body, and legs of a target simultaneously, potentially damaging Health, Action, and Mind pools simultaneously.
entries.unarmedcombo1: /unarmedcombo1 <target>: This unarmed attack can hit the head and body of a target simultaneously, potentially damaging both Health and Mind pools at once.
entries.unarmedbodyhit1: /unarmedbodyhit1 <target>: This unarmed attack targets an opponent's body in order to damage a target's Health pool.
entries.unarmedblind1: /unarmedblind1 <target>: This unarmed attack can blind a single target.
entries.twitch:
/twitch: You twitch.
/twitch self: You twitch nervously.
/twitch target: You twitch at (his, her, or its) comments.
entries.twistarm:
/twistarm: OK. OK. Twist my arm.
/twistarm self: Twist it just a bit more!
/twistarm target: You twist (his, her, or its) arm.
entries.twirl:
/twirl: You twirl around gracefully.
/twirl self: You put a finger on top of your head and twirl like a dancer.
/twirl target: You twirl (him, her, or it) around gracefully.
entries.twiddle:
/twiddle: You twiddle your thumbs.
/twiddle self: You patiently twiddle your thumbs.
/twiddle target: You twiddle your thumbs at (target name).
entries.twibble:
/twibble: Twibble. Twibble.
/twibble self: You twibble about in circles.
/twibble target: You twibble aimlessly about (him, her, or it).
entries.tweak:
/tweak: You tweak your neck. OUCH!
/tweak self: You tweak your own nose.
/tweak target: You tweak (his, her, or its) nose.
entries.tumbletostanding: /tumbletostanding: This command will roll you out of a kneeling or diving posture and leave you standing.
entries.tumbletoprone: /tumbletoprone: This command will attack while diving into a prone posture.
entries.tumbletokneeling: /tumbletokneeling:  This command will attack while rolling your character forward into a kneeling posture.
entries.tug:
/tug: You tug your gear to make sure it is secure.
/tug self: You tug your sleeves and straighten out your clothes.
/tug target: You tug on (his, her, or its) sleeve.
entries.tsktsk:
/tsktsk: You rub one index finger over the other. Tsk Tsk.
/tsktsk self: You should've known better! Tsk Tsk is right.
/tsktsk target: Tsk Tsk, (target name).
entries.trick2: /trick2: This command instructs your pet to do a trick.  Tricks heal pet Mind damage.
entries.trick1: /trick1: This command instructs your pet do a trick.  Tricks heal pet Mind damage.
entries.traz: This ability allows you to plays songs with the Traz instrument.
entries.transferforce: /transferForce <target>: This ability allows a Jedi to transfer some of his stored Force power to another player Jedi.
entries.train_mount: This ability allows you to train certain pets to be mounts that can be ridden.
entries.totalhealself: /totalHealSelf: Completely heals all of your Health, Action, and Mind damage, repairs all wounds, and removes all of your battle fatigue.
entries.totalhealother: /totalHealOther <player>: Completely heals all the Health, Action, and Mind damage, repairs all wounds, and removes all battle fatigue from the target player.
entries.toss:
/toss: You extend your arms like a child wanting to be tossed.
/toss self: You toss yourself into the air and land flat on your face.
/toss target: You toss (him, her, or it) into the air.
entries.torsoshot: /torsoshot <target>: This ranged attack douses a target in flames, causing high amounts of damage to the body as well as causing additional fire damage.
entries.tongue:
/tongue: You stick your tongue out.
/tongue self: You stick your tongue out and try to touch your nose.
/tongue target: You stick your tongue out at (target name).
entries.tmi:
/tmi: TOO MUCH INFO!!
/tmi self: Sorry everyone! TMI!
/tmi target: You politely inform (him, her, or it) that was too much info.
entries.tiptoe:
/tiptoe: You tiptoe though the area.
/tiptoe self: You practice tiptoeing silently.
/tiptoe target: You try to tiptoe past (target name).
entries.tiphat:
/tiphat:  You tip your hat.
/tiphat self:  You tip your hat to yourself.
/tiphat target:  You tip your hat to (him, her, or it).
entries.tip:
/tip: You tip your hat.
/tip self: You tip your hat to yourself.
/tip target: You tip your hat to (him, her, or it).
entries.tiny:
/tiny: You mark an approximation with your forefinger and thumb. It was tiny.
/tiny self: You guess that it would be tiny.
/tiny target: You indicate to (target name) with your forefinger and thumb that it was tiny.
entries.tickle:
/tickle: Time for the feather tickle torture?
/tickle self: You tickle yourself.
/tickle target: You tickle (him, her, or it) mercilessly.
entries.thxinfo:
/thxinfo: THX INFO!
/thxinfo self: k.thxinfo.byebye now.
/thxinfo target: You thank (him, her, or it) for the information.
entries.thumbup:
/thumbup: You show your approval.
/thumbup self: Life is pretty good after all!
/thumbup target: You show (target name) your approval.
entries.thumbsup:
/thumbsup: You show your approval.
/thumbsup self: Life is pretty good after all!
/thumbsup target: You show (target name) your approval.
entries.thumbsdown:
/thumbsdown: You show your disapproval.
/thumbsdown self: You should have known better.
/thumbsdown target: You show (target name) your disapproval.
entries.thumbdown:
/thumbdown: You show your disapproval.
/thumbdown self: You should have known better.
/thumbdown target: You show (target name) your disapproval.
entries.throwtrap: /throwtrap: This command is what you use to throw traps at creatures.  It's easier to simply hotkey the inventory item when using traps, however.
entries.throwgrenade: This command allows the user to throw a grenade.
entries.throwdown:
/throwdown: You throw down the gauntlet.
/throwdown self: There can only be one!
/throwdown target: You throw down the gauntlet at (his, her, or its) feet.
entries.throwat:
/throwat:  You throw pebble-sized stones, aimlessly passing the time.
/throwat self:  You throw yourself at the enemy.
/throwat target:  You throw (target name) at the enemy.
entries.throw:
/throw: You throw pebble-sized stones, aimlessly passing the time.
/throw self: You throw yourself at the enemy.
/throw target: You throw (target name) at the enemy.
entries.threatenshot: /threatenshot <target>: This ranged attack is useful for making skittish things flee from you.
entries.thirst:
/thirst: Feeling parched?
/thirst self: You feel so thirsty and beg for a drink.
/thirst target: You beg (target name) for a drink.
entries.thank:
/thank: You thank everyone.
/thank self: You thank yourself.
/thank target: You thank (him, her, or it).
entries.tendwound: /tendwound: This ability heals the wounds of a specified physical attribute without the need for medicine.  Using this causes minor wounding to your focus and willpower.
entries.tenddamage: /tenddamage: This ability heals health and action damage without the need for a stimpack.  Using this causes minor wounding to your focus and willpower.
entries.tell: /tell <name>:  This allows you to send a message instantly across the galaxy to a person whose name you know.  You can also send messages to multiple people via the following format: /tell ogakk,echuta,gekko <message> will send the same message to Ogakk, Echuta, and Gekko at the same time.  There must be no spaces between the commas and names for this additional function to work correctly.
entries.tease:
/tease: Just teasing!
/tease self: You tease your hair.
/tease target: You tease (him, her, or it).
entries.teach: This command allows a user to teach another player what he/she knows about a certain skill. Unlike training with a skill trainer, learning from another player has no cost.
entries.taunt: /taunt target: Increases the aggro that a mob in combat has towards you. This ability is useful to get mobs to attack you instead of other party members.
entries.tap:
/tap: You tap your foot impatiently.
/tap self: You tap your fingers on the table.
/tap target: You tap (target name) on (his, her, or its) shoulder.
entries.tantrum:
/tantrum: You throw a tantrum.
/tantrum self: You know you were wrong but throw a fit anyway.
/tantrum target: You throw a tantrum at (him, her, or it).
entries.tame: /tame <target>: Allows you to try to tame a creature.
entries.takecover: /takecover: Taking Cover allows the use of certain sneak attacks and gives you additional defense.  While in Cover, you can not move unless you have the Sneak skill.
entries.take_cover: /takecover: Taking Cover allows the use of certain sneak attacks and gives you additional defense.  While in Cover, you can not move unless you have the Sneak skill.
entries.tag:
/tag: You announce that you are playing tag.
/tag self: Who's it?
/tag target: TAG! You're it, (target name).
entries.tackle:
/tackle: You hunker down into a three-point stance.
/tackle self: You tackle yourself to the ground.
/tackle target: You tackle (him, her, or it) to the ground.
entries.sysgroup: /sysgroup <Message>: This command sends a system message to your group members, so that they see it immediately and in the center of their screens.
entries.sweep:
/sweep: You sweep the floor.
/sweep self: You try your best to look busy and sweep the floor.
/sweep target: You hand (him, her, or it) a broom.
entries.sweat:
/sweat: You sweat profusely.
/sweat self: You wipe the sweat from your brow and fling it to the ground.
/sweat target: You shake your body like a canine sending sweat flying at (him, her, or it).
entries.swat:
/swat: You swat at the air frantically.
/swat self: You swat yourself.
/swat target: You swat (him, her, or it) like an insect.
entries.survey: The /survey command is used in conjunction with a sample tool.  When you /survey your character will survey for whatever resource you last selected in the sample tool UI.  This allows you to perform a survey without using the sample tool UI.
entries.surrenderskill: This command is used to surrender a skill.
entries.surrender:
/surrender: You surrender.
/surrender self: You surrender yourself to your base instincts.
/surrender target: You concede and surrender to (target name).
entries.surpriseshot: /surpriseshot <target>: This ranged sneak attack must be performed from cover.
entries.surprised:
/surprised: Surprising, isn't it?
/surprised self: You look at yourself, completely surprised.
/surprised target: You look at (him, her, or it), completely surprised.
entries.suppressionfire2: /suppressionfire2 <target>: This ranged attack is used to drive your opponent into a lower position.  If they were standing, they kneel, if they were kneeling, they go prone.
entries.suppressionfire1: /suppressionfire1 <target>: This ranged attack is used to drive your opponent into a lower position.  If they were standing, they kneel, if they were kneeling, they go prone.
entries.summon:
/summon: You make a summoning gesture.
/summon self: You summon all of your strength and courage.
/summon target: You summon (him, her, or it).
entries.sulk:
/sulk: You sulk.
/sulk self: You sulk to yourself.
/sulk target: You sulk at (him, her, or it).
entries.stunattack: This command utilizes the stun attack sequence.
entries.strut:
/strut: You strut.
/strut self: You strut about like a lantern bird displaying his feathers.
/strut target: You strut around (him, her, or it).
entries.structurestatus: This command allows the user to view the status of a structure.
entries.stretch:
/stretch: You stretch.
/stretch self: You warm up with a few stretching exercises.
/stretch target: You help (him, her, or it) stretch.
entries.strangle:
/strangle: You strangle yourself.
/strangle self: Your eyes bulges from your skull due to lack of breathable air.
/strangle target: You strangle (him, her, or it).
entries.strafeshot2: /strafeshot2 <target>: This ranged attack clears your enemy out of a covered state, making them more vulnerable to attack.
entries.strafeshot1: /strafeshot1 <target>: This ranged attack clears your enemy out of a covered state, making them more vulnerable to attack.
entries.stoppingshot: /stoppingshot <target>: This devastatingly powerful attack is known as the Stopping Shot because it has a tendency to stop rushing enemies in their tracks, by killing or incapacitating them with one hit.
entries.stopfollow: /stopfollow: Use this command to immediately stop following somebody (initiated via /follow).
entries.stopcraftingsession: This command allows the user to stop a crafting session.
entries.stopbleeding: /stopBleeding <player>: Causes the target to stop bleeding, negating that particular damage over time state.
entries.stop:
/stop: Everybody stop!
/stop self: You bravely try to stop the onrushing world.
/stop target: You order (target name) to stop.
entries.stomp:
/stomp: *STOMP* *STOMP*
/stomp self: You stomp around, ready to mosh.
/stomp target: You stomp on (him, her, or it).
entries.stink:
/stink: What is that smell?!
/stink self: UGH! You DO stink!
/stink target: That bad huh? Guess so since you just told (him, her, or it).
entries.steam:
/steam: You boil with rage as steam pours from the top of your head.
/steam self: You notice that steam is pouring off your body.
/steam target: You boil over with rage at (target name).
entries.steadyaim: /steadyaim: This Squad Leader command increases the chance for the party member's next shots to hit their target.  This ability costs more or less pool points based on how many people are in the party at the time the ability is used.  Use the /setsteadyaim <message> command to set what the Squad Leader shouts when they use this command.
entries.startleshot2: /startleshot2 <target>: This ranged attack is meant to startle your opponent into a raised position.  If they were lying prone, they kneel, if they were kneeling, they stand up.  This causes more damage than Startle Shot 1.
entries.startleshot1: /startleshot1 <target>: This ranged attack is meant to startle your opponent into a raised position.  If they were lying prone, they kneel, if they were kneeling, they stand up.
entries.stare:
/stare: You stare blankly into space.
/stare self: You try to stare yourself down and go cross-eyed.
/stare target: You stare at (target name).
entries.stand: /stand: This command will bring you to a standing position.
entries.squirm:
/squirm: You squirm.
/squirm self: You squirm uneasily.
/squirm target: You try to squirm away from (target name).
entries.squeeze:
/squeeze: You squeeze your emotion management toy.
/squeeze self: You squeeze yourself.
/squeeze target: You squeeze (target name) tightly.
entries.sprayshot: /sprayshot <target>: This ranged attack is highly damaging, and has a chance to blind, dizzy, and stun a target.
entries.splitcreditswithgroup: /splitCreditsWithGroup <amount>: allows a group member to split the specified amount of coins amongst nearby player group members.
entries.spit:
/spit: You spit.
/spit self: You spit in your hands and prepare to get down to business.
/spit target: You spit at (him, her, or it).
entries.spin:
/spin: You spin around to see who is behind you.
/spin self: You spin around and make yourself dizzy.
/spin target: You spin (target name) around until (him, her, or it) is dizzy.
entries.speaknoevil:
/speaknoevil: You cover your mouth.
/speaknoevil self: You stare blankly forward with your hand over your mouth.
/speaknoevil target: You cover your mouth and refuse to speak.
entries.spam:
/spam: SPAM!
/spam self: You send yourself reeling and your head spinning.
/spam target: You tell (him, her, or it) to QUIT SPAMMING!
entries.space_navigator: The Sullustan race is very savvy at navigating space lanes. Their hyperspace recycle time is much shorter than normal species.
entries.softclap:
/softclap: You show your approval with a soft applause.
/softclap self: You give yourself a soft applause.
/softclap target: You give (him, her, or it) an approving, soft applause.
entries.soapbox:
/soapbox: You place a soapbox on the ground and offer the use of it.
/soapbox self: You place a soapbox on the ground, climb upon it, and begin to speak.
/soapbox target: You try to pull (him, her, or it) down from (his, her, or its) soapbox.
entries.snort:
/snort: SNORT!
/snort self: You snort derisively.
/snort target: You snort at (target name).
entries.snore:
/snore: You snore loudly.
/snore self: You snore softly.
/snore target: You snore loudly at (target name), displaying your boredom.
entries.snog:
/snog: ~
/snog self: You attempt snogging yourself.
/snog target: You attempt to engage in some serious snogging with (target name).
entries.snipershot: /snipershot <target>: This very powerful ranged attack can kill incapacitated targets at a distance.
entries.sniffle:
/sniffle: You sniffle.
/sniffle self: You sniffle to yourself.
/sniffle target: You sniffle at (target name).
entries.sniff:
/sniff: You sniff sadly.
/sniff self: You sniff sadly to yourself.
/sniff target: You sniff sadly at (him, her, or it).
entries.snicker:
/snicker: You snicker.
/snicker self: You snicker at your own evil thoughts.
/snicker target: You snicker at (him, her, or it).
entries.sneeze:
/sneeze: AAAAACHOOOO!
/sneeze self: You sneeze, covering your hands in a mucous substance.
/sneeze target: You sneeze at (target name), covering (him, her, or it) with slime.
entries.sneer:
/sneer: You sneer.
/sneer self: You sneer at the thought.
/sneer target: You sneer at (him, her, or it).
entries.sneak: Sneak is an innate ability that allows you to slowly move while prone and taking cover.
entries.snarl:
/snarl: You snarl, baring your teeth.
/snarl self: You snarl and grumble surly under your breath.
/snarl target: You snarl at (him, her, or it).
entries.snap:
/snap: SNAP!
/snap self: Shucks!
/snap target: You snap beckoningly at (him, her, or it).
entries.smirk:
/smirk: You smirk.
/smirk self: You smirk at yourself.
/smirk target: You smirk at (target name).
entries.smile:
/smile: You smile.
/smile self: You smile at yourself.
/smile target: You smile at (target name).
entries.smell:
/smell: You smell the air.
/smell self: You smell yourself.
/smell target: You smell (him, her, or it).
entries.small:
/small: You hold your hands about 2 fists apart, signifying it was small.
/small self: You guess that it would be small.
/small target: You indicate to (target name) that is was small.
entries.slobber:
/slobber: Need a bib?
/slobber self: You slobber all over yourself.
/slobber target: You slobber all over (him, her, or it).
entries.slitherhorn: This ability allows you to plays songs with the Slitherhorn instrument.
entries.slit:
/slit: Someone's gonna die.
/slit self: You think you're not long for this world.
/slit target: You don't think (target name) is long for this world.
entries.slice_weaponsbasic: the smuggler gains the ability to make small modifications to the stats of a weapon from the
radial menu option on the weapon.
entries.slice_weaponsadvanced: the smuggler gains the ability to make more effective modifications to the stats of a weapon from the
radial menu option on the weapon.
entries.slice_terminals: the smuggler gains the ability to hack mission terminals for extra pay using the
entries.slice_sockets: the smuggler can hack equipment to potentially add an extra expansion socket to the item.
entries.slice_containers: smugglers get the option to hack into locked containers with a
entries.slice_armor: the smuggler gains the ability to make modifications to the stats of armor from the
radial menu option on the armor piece.
entries.slap:
/slap: WAKE UP! You slap yourself in the face. *SMACK!*
/slap self: You slap yourself silly.
/slap target: You slap (him, her, or it) across the face.
entries.skip:
/skip: You skip around the area.
/skip self: You skip in figure eights.
/skip target: You skip around (target name).
entries.sit: /sit: This command will bring you into a sitting position, from which combat is not possible.  If furniture is not present, you will sit on the ground.
entries.sigh:
/sigh: You sigh.
/sigh self: You sigh with relief.
/sigh target: You sigh at (him, her, or it).
entries.shush:
/shush: SHUSH!
/shush self: You shush yourself.
/shush target: You quickly shush (him, her, or it).
entries.shudder:
/shudder: You shudder.
/shudder self: You shudder at the thought.
/shudder target: You shudder at (him, her, or it).
entries.shrug:
/shrug: You shrug.
/shrug self: You shrug your shoulders helplessly.
/shrug target: You shrug helplessly at (target name).
entries.shower:
/shower: You go to take a shower.
/shower self: You shower yourself in water from a jug.
/shower target: You politely inform (target name) that (he, she or it) needs to take a shower.
entries.shoo:
/shoo: You ask everyone to just leave.
/shoo self: You're asking yourself to leave?
/shoo target: You tell (target name) to leave.
entries.shiver:
/shiver: You shiver.
/shiver self: You shiver and rub your arms in an attempt to warm up.
/shiver target: You shiver at the coldness surrounding (target name).
entries.sharpen:
/sharpen: You sharpen your nails.
/sharpen self: You sharpen your teeth with a file.
/sharpen target: You sharpen a blade menacingly at (him, her, or it).
entries.shake:
/shake: You shake your head negatively.
/shake self: You shake your head negatively at yourself.
/shake target: You shake your head negatively at (him, her, or it).
entries.setspokenlanguage: This command sets a spoken language.
entries.setformationslot: /setformationslot: Set the targeted group member into a slot from 1 to 20.
entries.setformation: /setformation: Set the formation that a group should use in space.
entries.send: This command allows the user to send a tell or mail to another player.
entries.selectdraftschematic: This command selects a draft schematic.
entries.seenoevil:
/seenoevil: SEE NO EVIL!!
/seenoevil self: You peek through your fingers covering your eyes.
/seenoevil target: You peek through your fingers at (target name).
entries.scream:
/scream: AAAARRRRRGGGGHHHHH!!!
/scream self: You scream loudly at yourself in frustration.
/scream target: You scream with frustration in (his, her, or its) ear.
entries.scratch:
/scratch: You scratch an itch.
/scratch self: You scratch the nape of your neck pensively.
/scratch target: You scratch (his, her, or its) back.
entries.scowl:
/scowl: You scowl.
/scowl self: You scowl at yourself.
/scowl target: You scowl at (him, her, or it).
entries.scold:
/scold: You produce a measuring stick and brandish it authoritatively.
/scold self: You scold yourself with slap on the hand.
/scold target: You scold (him, her, or it).
entries.scattershot2: /scattershot2 <target>: This ranged attack can hit multiple stat pools on a target at once. This is a more damaging attack than Scatter Shot 1.
entries.scattershot1: /scattershot1 <target>: This ranged attack can hit multiple stat pools on a target at once.
entries.scared:
/scared: You jump and whip around to face the noise.
/scared self: You shrink away, looking very scared.
/scared target: You shrink away from (target name), looking very scared of (him, her, or it).
entries.scare:
/scare: BOO!
/scare self: You scare yourself.
/scare target: You sneak up and try to scare (him, her, or it).
entries.sampledna: /sampledna <target>: This Bio-Engineer ability allows you to sample the DNA of a creature.  You must be fairly close to it for this to function correctly.
entries.sample: The /sample command is used in conjunction with a sample tool.  When you /sample your character will take a sample of whatever resource you last selected from the sample tool UI.  This allows you to perform sampling without using the sample tool UI.
entries.salute:
/salute: You salute.
/salute self: You stand at attention and salute yourself.
/salute target: You salute (target name).
entries.saberthrow3: /saberThrow3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to attack multiple targets from a distance by throwing his or her lightsaber and guiding it with the Force. A successful attack will also cause a chance to knock your opponent down.
entries.saberthrow2: /saberThrow2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do greater damage from a distance by throwing his or her lightsaber and guiding it with the Force. A successful attack will also cause a chance to knock your opponent down.
entries.saberthrow1: /saberThrow1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to attack from a distance by throwing his or her lightsaber.
entries.saberslash2: /saberSlash2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to cause the target to bleed, as well as lower the target's posture. This attack is more powerful than Saber Slash 1 and can be used with all lightsaber types.
entries.saberslash1: /saberSlash1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to cause the target to bleed, as well as lower the target's posture. This attack can be used with all lightsaber types.
entries.saberpolearmspinattack3: /saberPolearmSpinAttack3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do increased damage to all enemies in the immediate area. This attack is more powerful than Saber Polearm Spin Attack 2, and also has a slightly increased range.
entries.saberpolearmspinattack2: /saberPolearmSpinAttack2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do increased damage to all enemies in the immediate area. This attack is more powerful than Saber Polearm Spin Attack 1, and also has a slightly increased range.
entries.saberpolearmspinattack1: /saberPolearmSpinAttack1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to deal damage to all enemies in the immediate area.
entries.saberpolearmleghit3: /saberPolearmLegHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against a target's legs, increasing the chance of affecting its action pool. This attack is more powerful than the Saber Polearm Leg Hit 2.
entries.saberpolearmleghit2: /saberPolearmLegHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a precise against a target's legs, increasing the chance of affecting its action pool. This attack is more powerful than the Saber Polearm Leg Hit 1.
entries.saberpolearmleghit1: /saberPolearmLegHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's legs, increasing the chance of affecting its action pool.
entries.saberpolearmhit3: /saberPolearmHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do significantly more damage than normal with a double-bladed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than the Saber Polearm Hit 2, and also has a chance to stun the target.
entries.saberpolearmhit2: /saberPolearmHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do significantly more damage than normal with a double-bladed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than the Saber Polearm Hit 1, and also has a chance to stun the target.
entries.saberpolearmhit1: /saberPolearmHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do more damage than normal with a double-bladed lightsaber.
entries.saberpolearmdervish2: /saberPolearmDervish2 <target>: This ultimate attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a double-bladed lightsaber that damages all enemies in a cone radius outward from the Jedi, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizzyness.
entries.saberpolearmdervish: /saberPolearmDervish <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a double-bladed lightsaber that damages all enemies in the immediate area, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizzyness.
entries.saber_block: Allows a Jedi to block many types of energy bolts and several types of projectiles with a lightsaber.
entries.saber2hsweep3: /saber2hSweep3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to cause their target to lower its posture, as well as dealing more damage than Saber Two Hand Sweep 2.
entries.saber2hsweep2: /saber2hSweep2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to cause their target to lower its posture, as well as a small damage increase over Saber Two Hand Sweep 1.
entries.saber2hsweep1: /saber2hSweep1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to cause their target to lower its posture.
entries.saber2hphantom: /saber2hFrenzy <target>: This ultimate attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a two-handed lightsaber that damages all enemies in a cone radius outwards from the Jedi, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizziness.
entries.saber2hhit3: /saber2hHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do much more damage than normal with a two-handed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than Saber Two Hand Hit 2.
entries.saber2hhit2: /saber2hHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do significantly more damage than normal with a two-handed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than Saber Two Hand Hit 1.
entries.saber2hhit1: /saber2hHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do more damage than normal with a two-handed lightsaber.
entries.saber2hfrenzy: /saber2hFrenzy <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a two-handed lightsaber that damages all enemies in the immediate area, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizziness.
entries.saber2hbodyhit3: /saber2hBodyHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's body, increasing the chance of affecting its health pool. This attack is more powerful than Saber Two Hand Body Hit 2.
entries.saber2hbodyhit2: /saber2hBodyHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's body, increasing the chance of affecting its health pool. This attack is more powerful than Saber Two Hand Body Hit 1.
entries.saber2hbodyhit1: /saber2hBodyHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's body, increasing the chance of affecting its health pool.
entries.saber1hhit3: /saber1hHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do significantly more damange than normal with a one-handed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Hit 2.
entries.saber1hhit2: /saber1hHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do significantly more damange than normal with a one-handed lightsaber. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Hit 1.
entries.saber1hhit1: /saber1hHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to do more damage than normal with a one-handed lightsaber.
entries.saber1hheadhit3: /saber1hHeadHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's head,  increasing the chance of affecting its mind pool. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Head Hit 2, and has a chance of blinding the target.
entries.saber1hheadhit2: /saber1hHeadHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's head,  increasing the chance of affecting its mind pool. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Head Hit 1, and has a chance of blinding the target.
entries.saber1hheadhit1: /saber1hHeadHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a strike against the target's head, increasing the chance of affecting its mind pool.
entries.saber1hflurry2: /saber1hFlurry2 <target>: This ultimate attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a one-handed lightsaber that damages all enemies in the immediate area, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizziness.
entries.saber1hflurry: /saber1hFlurry <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to perform a devastating move with a one-handed lightsaber that damages all enemies in the immediate area, as well as inflicting stun, blind, and dizziness.
entries.saber1hcombohit3: /saber1hComboHit3 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to hit multiple locations on the target's body and has a chance to lower the target's posture. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Combo Hit 2, and will likely do more damage.
entries.saber1hcombohit2: /saber1hComboHit2 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to hit multiple locations on the target's body and has a chance to lower the target's posture. This attack is more powerful than the Saber One Hand Combo Hit 1, and will likely do more damage.
entries.saber1hcombohit1: /saber1hComboHit1 <target>: This attack allows a Jedi to hit multiple locations on the target's body. This attack will do more damage than a normal one-handed saber attack.
entries.ruffle:
/ruffle: You look ruffled.
/ruffle self: You ruffle your own hair.
/ruffle target: You ruffle (his, her, or its) hair.
entries.rude:
/rude: You offer an unknown salute.
/rude self: You give yourself a rude gesture.
/rude target: You give (target name) an unknown salute.
entries.rubnose:
/rubnose: You rub your nose.
/rubnose self: You rub your nose on your sleeve.
/rubnose target: You rub noses with (target name).
entries.rtell: /rtell <message>: Automatically sends a tell to the last person whom you sent one to.
entries.rose:
/rose: You extend a rose and offer it.
/rose self: You give yourself a rose and smell deeply of its scent.
/rose target: You give (target name) a rose.  -----`---,---<@
entries.rollshot: /rollshot: A roll shot will cause you to kneel and attack at the same time, leaving you in a kneeling position.
entries.rolleyes:
/rolleyes:  You roll your eyes.
/rolleyes self:  You roll your eyes and they fall back into your skull.
/rolleyes target:  You roll your eyes at (target name).
entries.roll:
/roll: You roll your eyes.
/roll self: You roll your eyes and they fall back into your skull.
/roll target: You rolls your eyes at (target name).
entries.rofl:
/rofl: Want a hand getting up?
/rofl self: You roll on the floor laughing at yourself.
/rofl target: You roll on the floor laughing at (target name).
entries.roar:
/roar: ROOOOOOAAAAARRRRRR!!!!
/roar self: You roar loudly at yourself.
/roar target: You roar loudly at (target name).
entries.right:
/right: You point right.
/right self: You point right.
/right target: You turn to (target name) and point right.
entries.reviveplayer: /reviveplayer <target>: This very powerful command enables you to revive an almost dead player, bypassing the need to clone if you have the appropriate medical equipment handy.
entries.retreat: /retreat:  This very powerful Squad Leader ability drains the Squad Leader's Action and Mind pools while giving their entire group Burst Run.  Intended for hard encounters gone horribly wrong, it allows the Squad Leader to show true leadership by sacrificing themself for the greater good of their group.
entries.restartcraftingsession: This command allows the user to restart a crafting session.
entries.rescue: /rescue <target>: This enables you to anger an NPC that is on a party member, so that the NPC attacks you instead of the person you are rescuing.  This is not guaranteed to work.
entries.requestcraftingsession: This command requests a crafting session for the user.
entries.reply: /reply <message>: Automatically sends a /tell to the last person who sent you one.
entries.repairshipcomponent: Repair  a ship component in a ship.
entries.repairbattlefieldstructure: This command allows the user to repair a battlefield structure.
entries.reload: This command allows the user to reload.
entries.registerwithlocation: Provided the appropriate skill-set for the venue, this command allows the user to register with an inactive planetary map location marking it as active (
entries.registered: Your city has been registered on the planetary map.
entries.regeneration: /regeneration: short-term consitution attribute buff; alias for
entries.regainconsciousness: /regainConsciousness: This ability allows a Jedi to instantly recover from an unconscious state.  The Jedi will still be weak and weary but can then proceed to use other Force abilities to return to normal.
entries.recruitskilltrainer: /recruitskilltrainer: Allows the politician to place a skill trainer within the borders of his city.
entries.reassure:
/reassure: You reassure everyone that it will turn out OK.
/reassure self: You reassure yourself that everything will be OK.
/reassure target: You reassure (him, her, or it) that everything will be fine.
entries.ready:
/ready: READY!
/ready self: You check to see if you are ready.
/ready target: I'm ready, (target name)!
entries.raspberry:
/raspberry: You give everyone a raspberry. PFFFFFFTTTT!!
/raspberry self: You give yourself a raspberry.
/raspberry target: You give (him, her, or it) a raspberry.
entries.ranged_damage_mitigation_3: This ability will further limit the damage range done to you when you are attacked with a ranged weapon.
entries.ranged_damage_mitigation_2: This ability will further limit the damage range done to you when you are attacked with a ranged weapon.
entries.ranged_damage_mitigation_1: This ability will limit the damage range done to you when you are attacked with a ranged weapon.
entries.rally: /rally: This Squad Leader command improves the combat defense and to hit modifiers of everyone in the party.  The Squad Leader must be the party's leader in order for this to function.
entries.raise:
/raise: You raise your hand.
/raise self: You raise your hands in the air.
/raise target: You raise (his, her, or its) hand and declare (him, her, or it) the victor.
entries.quiet:
/quiet: You hold your finger to your lips, indicating to be quiet.
/quiet self: You quiet yourself and place your finger vertically across your lips.
/quiet target: You hold an extended finger over your lips, indicating to (target name) to be quiet.
entries.quickheal: /quickheal <target>: This ability allows for an instant, medicine-free pool damage heal on a target, at a very heavy Mind cost to the Medic.  This ability also causes 10 Wounds to the Medic's Willpower and Focus pools, so it must not be used lightly.
entries.question:
/question: You question the intent.
/question self: You question your own intent.
/question target: You question (his, her, or its) intent.
entries.puzzle:
/puzzle: You puzzle over the current situation.
/puzzle self: You puzzle over your own thoughts.
/puzzle target: You puzzle over (him, her, or it).
entries.push:
/push: You make a pushing motion as if trying to keep things away from yourself.
/push self: You push yourself to the ground.
/push target: You push (him, her, or it) away.
entries.purchaseticket: This command allows the user to purchase a ticket.
entries.purchasereinforcement: This command utilizes the purchase reinforcement option.
entries.punch:
/punch: You shadow-box.
/punch self: You punch yourself in the face, giving yourself a black eye.
/punch target: You punch (target name) in the face.
entries.pumpreactor: /pumpreactor: Temporarily increases reactor and engine output.
entries.pull:
/pull self: You raise your hand in the air and pull it back down in a victorious manner.
/pull target: You try to pull (him, her, or it) along.
entries.puke:
/puke: You puke.
/puke self: You puke all over yourself.
/puke target: You puke all over (him, her, or it).
entries.pucker: Not if I see you first!
Not if I see you first!
